page.title: 03CHANGE IN THURLASTON -2
page.content: There were two Marl pits in Thurlaston. They were dug yearly and spread to give soil body.One pit was filled in and is under the M45,while the other at the end of the village was used for the village refuse tip when no dustman came to the village. At the start of this century twenty thatched cottages were built,seven near the A45.Now there are only two,with two others having tinned roofs.When fire insurances were introduced,plaques or metal discs were fixed on the house.Today a plaque can be seen on Stanley's farmhouse,next to Church Lane. Before the motorway,a straight lane led into the village and where the motorway crosses a large shallow pond, the Town pit, was used for watering the horses on their way home.
